embarrassment

Listen:

UK:*UK and possibly other pronunciationsUK and possibly other pronunciations/ɪmˈbærəsmənt/US:USA pronunciation: IPA and respellingUSA pronunciation: IPA/ɛmˈbærəsmənt/ ,USA pronunciation: respelling(em bar′əs mənt)

embarrassment

WordReference English Thesaurus © 2024

Sense: The condition of being embarrassed

Synonyms:

confusion Collocations, chagrin, mortification, discomfiture, shame Collocations, humiliation, abashment, discomposure, discomfort Collocations, disconcertment, disconcertion, bashfulness, self-consciousness, shyness, timidity, inhibition, awkwardness, perplexity, distress Collocations, fluster, flurry Collocations, shamefacedness, egg on one's face, discombobulation, stew Collocations

Sense: Anything that embarrasses

Synonyms:

mistake Collocations, blunder Collocations, faux pas, awkwardness, clumsiness, indebtedness, uncertainty Collocations, gaucherie, hindrance Collocations, poverty Collocations, impecuniosity, destitution, distress Collocations, difficulties, involvement Collocations, intricacy, obligation Collocations, crude action, stupid action, indiscretion, default Collocations, debt Collocations, awkward situation, predicament Collocations, dilemma, puzzle Collocations, perplexity, tangle Collocations, strait, pinch Collocations, quandary, plight Collocations, fix Collocations, hot seat, hot water, pickle Collocations, skeleton in the closet
